paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: primarily African American and Afro-Caribbean populations, age over 50

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with Val122Ile mutation typically present with severe progressive heart failure in patients over 50 years of age.
Patients with Val122Ile mutation typically present with severe progressive heart failure in patients over 50 years of age.
Among the carriers, some remain asymptomatic despite carrying the Val122Ile mutation.
Among the carriers, some remain asymptomatic despite carrying the Val122Ile mutation.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation leads to misfolding of the TTR protein, resulting in amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in the African American and Afro-Caribbean populations.
variants.population_frequency: Higher prevalence in specific ethnic groups, particularly in African Americans.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies linking the variant to disease.
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is the most common hereditary cardiac amyloidosis variant.
key_quotes: The most common hereditary cardiac amyloidosis is caused by Val122Ile mutation.
The clinical presentation varies widely based on mutation type, gene penetrance, age of onset, and prognosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
